prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I wanted to see a Steel Samurai rehearsal, just once.
Person: Cody
Testimony 1
Testimony: I found a map on the Internet, and went to the studios that day.
Person: Cody
Testimony 2
Testimony: I went through the woods, off the path, so that old lady wouldn't catch me.
Person: Cody
Testimony 3
Testimony: I was going for the studio.
Person: Cody
Testimony 4
Testimony: I got kinda lost on the way, though. For about 30 minutes.
Person: Cody
Testimony 5
Testimony: When I came out by the studio, there was the Steel Samurai!
Person: Cody
Testimony 6
Testimony: It totally rocked! Right before my eyes, out came the bad guy!
Person: Cody
Testimony 7
Testimony: Of course, the Steel Samurai took him down! Pow!
Person: Cody
Testimony 8
Testimony: If I had my camera with me, that woulda been the time for a shot, I tell you.
Person: Cody

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a contradiction between one of the evidences and one of the testimonies provided. Let's start by going through each evidence and testimony carefully.

First, the characters involved here are Maya Fey, Miles Edgeworth, Dick Gumshoe, Will Powers (the defendant), Security Lady (Oldbag), Jack Hammer (victim), Assistant Penny Nichols, Director Sal Manella, Cody Hackins, and Dee Vasquez. The key here is to see which evidence and testimony don't align.

Looking at the evidences, Evidence 11 is "Mr. Monkey's Head," which states it blocked the path to the crime scene between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM. That's an important time frame because the autopsy report (Evidence 3) says Jack's time of death was 2:30 PM. So, if the path was blocked from 2:15 onwards, anyone arriving after that time couldn't have gotten through unless they found another way.

Now, looking at the testimonies from Cody (Testimonies 0-8). Testimony 2 says he went through the woods, off the path, to avoid the security lady. Testimony 4 mentions he got lost for about 30 minutes and came out near the studio. The key here is the timing. If he entered the studio area after 2:15 PM, when Mr. Monkey's Head was blocking the path, but he managed to get through by going around, that might not contradict. However, the Security Lady (Oldbag) in previous testimonies (like Testimony 4 in a prior problem) claimed she was at the gate from 1 PM to 5 PM and only saw Powers go by at 2 PM. But here, Cody's testimony is that he snuck in through the woods, avoiding her. 

Wait, but the problem here is only Cody's testimonies. Let me focus on the current testimonies. Cody says he went through the woods, got lost for 30 minutes, and came out near the studio. If the path was blocked by Mr. Monkey's Head from 2:15 PM, but he came out at a time when the path was blocked, but he didn't use the path, that's okay. However, maybe the time he arrived at the studio? Let me check the timings again.

The murder happened at 2:30 PM. Cody's timeline: he went through the woods, got lost for 30 minutes. If he started his journey before 2:15, maybe he could have arrived before the blockage. But the problem is, when exactly did he arrive? The testimonies don't specify the exact time he arrived. However, the key point is that the path was blocked from 2:15 PM onward. If Cody claims he came out near the studio after that time but didn't use the blocked path, then there's no contradiction. But maybe the Monkey's Head was blocking all paths, not just the main one? The description says "blocked the path to the scene of the crime," so perhaps the main path. Since Cody went through the woods, avoiding the main path, then it's okay. 

Alternatively, maybe the Guidemap (Evidence 2) shows that the only way is through the main path, so the Monkey's Head blocking that path would mean Cody couldn't have gotten there after 2:15 unless he took another route. But since he did take another route, maybe that's allowed. Hmm, maybe not a contradiction here.

Wait, looking again at Evidence 11's description: "blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM." The path was blocked, so anyone arriving after 2:15 would need to go around. Cody says he went through the woods, so that's possible. But perhaps the Security Lady's testimony (not in current list, but previous ones) said she didn't see anyone else except Powers, but that's not part of current testimonies here. 

Wait, the current testimonies are only from Cody. The question is between the given evidences and testimonies here. Let me check the testimonies again. Cody's Testimony 5 says he saw the Steel Samurai (Will Powers) fight the bad guy (Jack) right before his eyes. If the murder happened at 2:30 PM (Evidence 3), then Cody must have arrived before or at that time. But if the path was blocked from 2:15, and he got lost for 30 minutes, perhaps he arrived after 2:30? Let's see:

Suppose Cody started his journey at, say, 2:00 PM. He took a wrong path, got lost for 30 minutes, so he would emerge around 2:30, just when the murder happens. But the path was blocked from 2:15, so if he was moving through the woods during that time, he could still arrive. The blockage is on the path, not the woods. So maybe no contradiction here.

Alternatively, maybe the Guidemap (Evidence 2) indicates that the only way to the studio is through the main path, so even going through the woods would require passing the blocked area. But that's speculative. 

Wait, another angle: Evidence 5 is a photo of Powers taken at the gate at 2:00 PM, showing him heading towards the studio. If Cody arrived after 2:15 via the woods, he could still have seen the murder at 2:30. But the contradiction might be in Testimony 2 where he says he went through the woods to avoid the security lady. If the security lady was at the gate from 1 PM to 5 PM (as per previous testimonies), then Cody's path through the woods would mean he didn't pass her, so she wouldn't have seen him. That's okay, but maybe the problem is with the time he arrived. 

Alternatively, maybe Evidence 11's blockage would prevent anyone from reaching the studio after 2:15 unless they went around, but the murder happened at 2:30, so if Cody arrived after 2:15 via the woods, he could still be there. 

Hmm, perhaps I'm overcomplicating. Let me check the testimonies again. Cody says he went through the woods, got lost for 30 minutes, came out near the studio, and saw the Steel Samurai fight. If the fight (the murder) was at 2:30, then he must have arrived by then. But if he was lost for 30 minutes, maybe he started his journey earlier. Let's say he arrived at 2:20, got lost until 2:50, but that's after the murder. Wait, no, the murder is at 2:30. 

Alternatively, maybe the time he got lost is before the blockage. Let me think: If the path was blocked from 2:15, and he went through the woods, perhaps he had to be there before 2:15 to witness the murder at 2:30? No, that doesn't make sense. 

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is between Evidence 15 (Cody's Camera) and his testimony that he didn't have it with him. Testimony 8 says "If I had my camera with me, that woulda been the time for a shot," implying he didn't have it. But Evidence 15 says he always carries it. So that's a contradiction! 

Wait, that's a good point. Evidence 15 says Cody's Camera is described as "A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it." But in Testimony 8, Cody says he didn't have it with him at the time he saw the murder. So that's a direct contradiction. 

So the pair would be Evidence 15 and Testimony 8. 

Wait, let me confirm again. The testimony says he didn't have it with him when he saw the Steel Samurai fight (the murder scene), but the evidence says he always carries it. So that's a contradiction. 

Yes, that's a solid contradiction. The other possible contradictions I thought of involved other testimonies not listed here, but within the current data, this seems correct.
</think>
